result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody J. Bennett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department. 1/2 served in jail and 1/2 on electronic monitor, if eligible according to jail rules.
Concurrent with: with any sentence currently serving

miscConds.notes: Pay costs and DNA surcharges. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Comply with any other probation rules currently under.
Submit DNA sample.
Early discharge after 6 months and if approved by Agent.
Bond will be applied and any refund returned to the poster.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
9:05 a.m. Defendant Cody J. Bennett in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

ADA Cousins states this is a joint recommendation. 
Atty Halverson concurs in requests early discharge if approve by agent. 

BY THE COURT:***PROBATION***
I/S Sentence: 120 days jail, with huber, 1/2 served in jail and 1/2 on electronic monitor, if eligible according to jail rules. 20 days credit, if revoked.
12 months Probation, concurrent to any other sentence
Condtions:
Comply with any other rules currently under.
Pay costs + DNA surcharge = $443.00
Submit DNA sample.
Early discharge after 6 months and approved by Agent.
Bond will be applied.

Prior: 1430 Torun Rd, Stevens Point, WI 54482 United States
Bond already posted and can be released today.
1:23 p.m. Defendant Cody J. Bennett appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Cass W Cousins appeared for State of Wisconsin. Warrant quashed. Bond reinstated.
Plea hearing on May 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Acalia N Halverson in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:19 AM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins addresses the Court.

Atty Halverson does not know where her client is, was expecting him to be here.

Court reviews the file.

State requests bench warrant.

BY THE COURT:
Court orders a bench  warrant for arrest.
Plea hearing on April 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

*If defendant able to get probation hold lifted then bond will be reconsidered

Defendant Cody J. Bennett not in court, defendant in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

1:08 p.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint
Defendant waives reading of Criminal Complaint
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties
Court advises defendant of right to counsel and can contact Public Defender's office for representation.
Defendant makes statements regarding the warrant. 

**Defendant would like to consult with an attorney
Defendant can contact Public Defender for Representation
Court orders defendant to see Public Defender today. 
States bond request is $1,000.00 with no specific non-monetary conditions.

BY THE COURT:
Warrant Quashed. 
Court enteres NG pleas on the defendants behalf.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.
